content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Extraction System at position (–3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
– A burner inserter located at (–3.5, 27.5) with a drop position at (–3.5, 28.5).

### Copper Cable Factory Interface at position (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of:
– A cable factory input chest at (2.5, 17.5).
– A dedicated factory burner inserter at (3.5, 17.5) (direction RIGHT); its connected neighbours include a burner inserter at (2.5, 16.5) and an assembling machine at (1.5, 19.5).

### Belt Depot at position (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
– A wooden chest placed at (3.5, 15.5) serving as the depot.
– An adjacent transport belt segment at (4.5, 15.5).
– A depot burner inserter placed at (3.5, 14.5) (direction UP) linking the depot to the belt network.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Transport Belt Connection Errors  
 – When attempting to connect transport belts, the target was erroneously treated as a Prototype.SteamEngine. To avoid this, always add an inserter that feeds items into the steam engine and use that inserter as the connection target.

• Entity Placement and Inventory Issues  
 – Wooden chest placement failed when the target was too distant. Ensure you move closer to the intended position before placement.  
 – Errors indicating “No wooden_chest in inventory” require verifying that the item is available prior to attempting placement.

• Variable Reference Errors  
 – A NameError due to an undefined ‘target_chest’ highlights the need for consistent and correct variable naming when referencing target entities.
